senses.sense_definition: To place two or more things side by side or close together.

examples.text: The surgeon carefully <w>apposed</w> the edges of the wound to ensure it healed correctly.
In the diagram, the two biological structures are <w>apposed</w> to show their connection.

senses.sense_definition: To put something in front of or in contact with another thing.

examples.text: He <w>apposed</w> his seal to the document as a sign of approval.
The layers of material were <w>apposed</w> to create a thicker barrier.

senses.sense_definition: To ask questions of someone; to examine or interrogate.

examples.text: The magistrate <w>apposed</w> the witness regarding the events of that night.
Students were <w>apposed</w> on their knowledge of Latin grammar.
